title: Top Places to visit in Kondagaon, Chhattisgarh
content:
Kondagaon a municipality about 70 kilometers from Jagdalpur city is the headquarter of Kondagaon district in the Indian state of Chhattisgarh. Kondagaon separated from Bastar district on 24 January 2012 and formed as 27th District of the Chhattisgarh state. It is mostly renowned for its bell metal craft and other art forms native to the tribal of Bastar. Also known as the Shilp sheher (lit. craft city) of the Chhattisgarh owing to the variety of indigenous crafts produced in the area.

Background

Kondagaon is located at 19.6 ° N 81.67 ° E. [2] It has an average elevation of 593 meters (1945 feet).

 

As of 2001 India census, [3] Kondagaon had a population of 26,772 Males constitute 50% of the population and females 50%. Kondagaon has an average literacy rate of 64%, higher than the national average of 59.5%: male literacy is 73%, and female literacy is 55%. In Kondagaon, 14% of the population is under 6 years of age.

 

Kondagaon lies on the NH 30 highway and can be reached from either Raipur or Jagdalpur. Frequent bus services are available to Kondagaon from Raipur and Jagdalpur. The nearest railway station is Jagdalpur. A helicopter strip has been temporarily constructed in the playground adjacent to the government college campus, which is used occasionally.

 

The town is quaint yet one of the fastest developing district headquarters in the state of Chhattisgarh.

 

A couple of hillocks that the skirts of the eastern outskirts of the town are being revamped as a tourist park by the forest department of the town. The park will host relocated common wild animals and fowls of the Bastar region. The major part of the hill is turned into recreational zone.

 

The Coconut Development Board located in southern frills of the city is a central government coconut development farm, sprawling across acre of coconut and assorted plantation.

 

Kondgaon is the hub of various handicrafts, famous as the world's Bastar handicrafts.

 

The bell metal craft practiced by most of the craftsmen in the town and adjacent villages is almost extinct of almost extinct wax form of sculpting art, internationally renowned.Bell-metal art forms of celebrated craftsmen of some late Dr. Jaidev Baghel (a national awardee), Sushil Sakhuja, Sukchand, Suresh Baghmare etc.

 

The government endow several schemes and policies to promote the art forms and artisans including sponsorship a select few second or third generation artisan for training in the national institute of design, making them trends with the aberration and also their art forms of the scope .

 

Kondagaon is famous for timber mills too, as the division hosts one of the largest forest divisions in the Indian subcontinent.

 

The town is known for the foodies, being migrants and settlers from various parts of India including the south and the north. Lala hotel is the oldest hotel in the town operating through post independence era, when kondagaon is as much as a small village. Nirala Chaat Bhandar is a patron pot in the maker of the town famous for relishing pot pours.in.
